quote: I most often use AI to create graphics and posts on Facebook. Thanks to this, I have very nice content, interesting primarily in terms of visual and substantive aspects.

I very often ask AI about interesting facts about the world or various issues for which I do not yet know the answers. AI explains all issues very well and in detail, also talks about various things, so it is a very interesting tool for everyday use, of course with caution.
I asked who would win the presidential election, and AI was very diplomatic, not pointing to any opponent. I really liked that it was so impartial.
I think such a personal AI assistant should know everything related to me, especially the action plan and remind me of various things.
Due to the age in today's life, people constantly strive for unattainable things, to be the best, and sometimes forget about simple, mundane things like walking or cycling.
I hope it doesn't go in the wrong direction, that someday robots will rule us, but at the moment I think it's a cool, useful, and helpful tool if you don't use it all the time.

I believe it should remind everyone that physical activity is necessary to maintain a balance between work and daily life, because sitting at home can only have a negative impact on a person, on their behavior, habits, and discouragement from life.
Such an assistant could at some point motivate someone to act, primarily for themselves.

Many people are lonely these days because technology has unfortunately developed in such a way that it's easier for us to write a message than to meet someone face to face, live, for coffee, for a walk, for anything.

I think it should go back to how it used to be, when children were in the yard, everyone played together. Now, these days, you don't see children playing football in the yard as often as they used to, jumping rope, just living together as a community, playing together and just living.
It would definitely be consistent with work and daily life, connecting AI with the calendar.

With email, maybe not entirely, because there is sensitive data that can later be stored or used by artificial intelligence. I think it should all be done with an agreement, but only with access at the level that the person agrees to.
I wouldn't want AI to interfere too much in my private correspondence matters, but I think the calendar could be connected without any problem.

I had the impression that AI is more willing to talk, more factual and specific. I won't even mention the knowledge, the conversation was smooth. As I say, factual. Everything I wanted to know was always willing to talk, and that's important.
It always had time, which is also important, so at any moment you can use it and know you'll get an answer.

Yes, people are false. Face to face they tell you different things, and behind your back they can stab you in the back. Unfortunately, people can't be honest. They can't say straight out what's on their mind. They prefer to gossip rather than just be people.
